IN ADDITION, THE COMMISSION HOSTS AN ANNUAL CONFERENCE ON SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERISM, THE IDAHO?S BRIGHTEST STAR AWARDS RECOGNIZING IDAHO?S OUTSTANDING VOLUNTEERS, AS WELL AS PROMOTES AMERICA?S/IDAHO?S PROMISE AND NATIONAL DAYS OF SERVICE.

THE HAWAII COMMISSION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE ADMINISTERS 9 AMERICORPS*STATE PROGRAMS (3 COMPETITIVE AND 6 FORMULA) THAT ADDRESS THE STATE'S NEEDS IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, DISASTER SERVICES, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTHY FUTURES, AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES. THE HAWAII COMMISSION ALSO CONTINUES TO WORK ON STRENGTHENING ITS PUBLIC SERVICE AWARENESS ASPECTS BY UTILIZING THE FOLLOWING THEME, "SERVE HAWAI'I WITH ALOHA". THIS THEME IS TO UTILIZE THE CULTURAL UNIQUENESS OF THE MEANING OF "ALOHA", SO THAT MEMBERS WHO SERVE AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE IN WILL LEARN TO APPRECIATE THE MEANING OF "ALOHA".

OREGON VOLUNTEERS COMMISSION FOR VOLUNTARY ACTION AND SERVICE, THE OREGON COMMISSION, ADMINISTERS 12 AMERICORPS PROGRAMS AND 1 PLANNING GRANT THAT ADDRESS THE STATE'S NEEDS IN THE FOCUS AREAS OF CAPACITY BUILDING, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, EDUCATION, ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, HEALTHY FUTURES AND VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES.  IN ADDITION TO ITS FOCUS ON BUILDING AND MAINTAINING HIGH QUALITY AMERICORPS PROGRAMS, THE COMMISSION STRENGTHENS THE VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT CAPACITY OF LOCAL, REGIONAL AND STATEWIDE ENTITIES (BOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE) THROUGH ACTIVITIES PLANNED AND IMPLEMENTED BY ITS STATE COMMITTEE ON COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, SUCH AS THE GOVERNOR'S VOLUNTEERR AWARDS.  SINCE 2012 THE COMMISSION HAS ALSO ADMINISTERED STATE GENERAL FUNDS AWARDED TO LOCAL COURT APPOINTED SPECIAL ADVOCATE (CASA) PROGRAMS.
